docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 23 -- As a frontier, the mud at the bottom of the world's oceans lacks the obvious glamour of a glowing moon. But it is nevertheless holding the attention these days of a growing number of the world's planners and...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Nov. 23 -- As a frontier, the mud at the bottom of the world's oceans lacks the obvious glamour of a glowing moon. But it is nevertheless holding the attention these days of a growing number of the world's planners and technicians in government and big business.

headline.main: For Planners at U.N., the Ocean Floor Is New Frontier

byline.original: By SAM POPE BREWERSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Uruguayan Chamber of Deputies passes measure to regulate human organ transplants; bill provides that all persons over age 21, upon entering hosp, must state whether or not they authorize use of body parts for scientific purposes in case of death

docs.snippet: Jimmy Ellis has changed his mind about a showdown bout with Joe Frazier that would settle the heavyweight title situation, according to Harry Markson, the president of Madison Square Garden's division of boxing.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jimmy Ellis has changed his mind about a showdown bout with Joe Frazier that would settle the heavyweight title situation, according to Harry Markson, the president of Madison Square Garden's division of boxing.

headline.main: Plan for Ellis-Frazier Garden Fight Canceled; W. B. A. CHAMPION TO MEET PERALTA Bout Scheduled for Dec. 20 in Montevideo -- Garden Hits Decision by Ellis

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 6 -- The Government of President Jorge Pacheco Areco has forbidden the Uruguayan press and radio to make any reference to the Tupamaros -- Uruguay's daring urban guerrillas -- without terming them common criminals. The action was...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 6 -- The Government of President Jorge Pacheco Areco has forbidden the Uruguayan press and radio to make any reference to the Tupamaros -- Uruguay's daring urban guerrillas -- without terming them common criminals. The action was taken after a Gallup poll showed considerable popular support for the guerrillas.
docs.abstract: Pacheco forbids press and radio to make any reference to Tupamaros without terming them common criminals; curbs apply to 7 related terms, which media have used to evade earlier ban; action follows Gallup poll finding that considerable popular support exists for guerrillas; Pellegrini Giampietro kidnapping by Tupamaros recalled; novelist and humorist M de Benedetti accuses Pacheco of being extremist and subversive; says Pacheco asked Gov Rockefeller, during recent visit, to persuade Pres Nixon to strengthen Uruguayan security forces

headline.main: URUGUAY DECIDES TO CENSOR PRESS; Acts as Gallup Poll Shows Popularity of Guerrillas

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 10 -To the probable exasperation of tourists, blind people and traditionalists, Argentina will begin issuing new money next month, in hopes of strengthening faith in her economy.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 26 -- Uruguay, an Atlantic coast nation, has joined the three Pacific coast countries of South America -- Peru, Chile and Ecuador -- in extending her territorial waters 200 miles out into the sea. The Uruguayan Senate gave final...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Dec. 26 -- Uruguay, an Atlantic coast nation, has joined the three Pacific coast countries of South America -- Peru, Chile and Ecuador -- in extending her territorial waters 200 miles out into the sea. The Uruguayan Senate gave final approval to the Government's declaration Christmas Eve.

headline.main: Uruguay's Territorial Limit Extended to 200 Miles at Sea
